extraInfo.content: The story was wrapped up in a four-part comic book series in 2015.
The series storyline is rounded out in the pilot episode of Greg Garcia's next sitcom Raising Hope.
On February 9, 2022, Hulu revived the series with a 20-episode order set to premiere in 2023.
The creator revealed the planned ending for the show after it was cancelled.
The show was rebooted in 2021 under the name "4400".
The show was originally cancelled after the third season, but was successfully revived with the help of a petition gathering over 100,000 signatures.

The finale was very poorly received at the time it was aired, which is a running joke throughout Curb Your Enthusiasm. A fictional reunion of Seinfeld takes place inside of Curb Your Enthusiasm in season 7, episode 10.
A few years after the airing of the finale, a script for an alternate ending was leaked on the internet.
Although fans have often considered the ending to be something of a cliffhanger, creator Joss Whedon says that isn't the case.
The show itself ends on a cliffhanger, but is followed by a movie.
The show itself ends on a cliffhanger, but is followed by a movie.
The network released an epilogue to the series to provide closure after its cancellation.
A movie was planned, but was ultimately cancelled. In an interview in April 2018 the creator said that he was considering rebooting the series as a book.
Some extra detail is given in an episode of the show "Benson".
The cliffhanger of the original show is resolved in a follow-up movie. There is also a three-season continuation, which    premiered in 2012.

Although Scrubs received a total of nine seasons, most fans consider season 8 to be the true ending to the show. Season 9 takes place at a different location and only three of the seven main characters from the first eight seasons remained as regular main characters.
The show has a spinoff/sequel miniseries called Heroes Reborn. It does not resolve the cliffhanger ending to Heroes, however.

The season three DVD contains a "wrap-up" called Kyle XY: Future Revealed, with the writers and actors explaining their plans for future episodes and what would have ultimately happened in the series ending.
The creator of the show revealed information on what would have happened after the first season in an interview.
The cast revealed in an interview what could've happened in season 2.
The creator of the show created a comic book follow-up to the series.

In June 2021, the series was canceled by NBC after three seasons. The series was added to Netflix shortly before it was canceled and immediately topped the viewing charts, persuading Netflix to renew Manifest for a fourth and final season consisting of twenty episodes, with part one premiering on November 4, 2022.
A TV movie called Zoey's Extraordinary Christmas was made by The Roku Channel and premiered on December 1st, 2021.
An epilogue was release to wrap up some of the story.
A reboot series was announced in 2020.
Three original novels written by Max Allan Collins expand upon the Dark Angel television series, with two picking up directly where the series ended, and another serving as a prequel.
In response to criticism of the cancellation of the show after the second season and its cliffhanger ending, a two-and-a-half-hour series finale was produced and released.

Westworld was intended to end with its fifth season, according to statements from its two showrunners, Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joy. It was cancelled just a few months after its fourth season concluded.

Firefly was cancelled after 11 of 14 produced episodes were aired, but the post-airing success of the show led writer and director Whedon and Universal Pictures to produce Serenity, a 2005 film which continues the story from the series.

Netflix renewed Inside Job for a second season in June 2022; however, Takeuchi announced in January 2023 that Netflix had cancelled the series, including the second season. There is an active petition to save the show.

Although NBC canceled the series after one season, the series was renewed three days later following negotiations with Sony Pictures Television. The ten-episode second season premiered on March 11, 2018, and ran until NBC canceled the series again in June 2018. One month later, NBC ordered a two-part finale to conclude the series, which aired on December 20, 2018.

Because ABC intended to cancel the series, the last episode of the first season ends with an intentional cliffhanger. This episode received much better than expected ratings; ABC changed its mind and renewed the show for a second season, which was made as a prequel, keeping the cliffhanger ending intact chronologically.
In February 2020, the series was cancelled after seven seasons. The show's storyline concluded with the feature-length Ray Donovan: The Movie, which premiered on January 14, 2022, on Showtime.

A fifth "revival" season premiered on April 4, 2017. In January 2018, Fox confirmed that season 6 was in early development; however, in August 2019, Fox announced that it had no current plans to revive Prison Break.

Adult Swim cancelled the series after three seasons due to the proposed merger of WarnerMedia and Discovery. In September 2022, creator Olan Rogers claimed on Twitter that the series would be written off as a loss for tax purposes by Warner Bros.
On November 29, 2018, Netflix canceled the series after three seasons. A reboot was confirmed to be in development for Disney+ in May of 2022 and is scheduled to premiere in early 2024.
Creator Joseph Mallozzi made a series of blog posts detailing what the plans for the final two seasons would have been. [1] [2] [3]
After the show's cancellation, showrunner Mike Flanagan shared his plans for season 2 on Tumblr.
On July 28, 2022 it was reported that the series has been renewed for a second season by AMC+. A few months later, the series was canceled as AMC+ decided to not move forward with the second season.
The creator has shared some details on how the story would have progressed on his Tumblr blog.
A third season was offered by MTV, but was unable to be completed due to prior commitments. In June 2010, a Human Giant reunion sketch was shown at the MTV Movie Awards.
In April 2020, the cast reprised their roles for a special episode that was created during the COVID-19 pandemic. It first aired on NBC and raised funds for Feeding America.
The Teen Titans comic continued the story to give the series a happy ending.
The Teen Titans comic continued the story to give the series a happy ending.
Twin Peaks originally ran for two seasons until its cancellation in 1991. The show returned in 2017 for a third season on Showtime.
The final episode ends ambiguously, but is not considered a cliffhanger, as the outcome is heavily implied.
The series was canceled after only three episodes had aired.

The series originally ran until May 18, 1998, after airing a total of 247 episodes over ten seasons. In January 2018, it was announced that CBS ordered a 13-episode revival of Murphy Brown, which premiered on September 27, 2018. CBS canceled the revival after one season on May 10, 2019.

A revival 10th season premiered in 2018, and was renewed for an 11th. ABC reversed its renewal decision and canceled the show after the show's creator posted a series of racist and Islamophobic posts on Twitter.
A direct-to-video film is currently in production and will premiere on Adult Swim and HBO Max. The film will act as a finale to the series.
The series was canceled after half of the first season was released. The remaining episodes are available on the Tubi streaming service.
